dialogues.text: Hate to be bothering you like this, but me mare threw a shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor looks to Romirez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Senor. (gestures to wine) I have my friend to keep me company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back when I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor sets off across the pasture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romirez enters and flops onto a cot. Settling down for a nap, he sets his sword beneath the be and closes his eyes to the distant sound of CHILDREN play The room is still. Romirez begins to drowse. Suddenly his eyes leap open with full alertness. His hand moves under the cot. With an EXPLOSION the front door is lifted from its hinge and splintered into fragments.  Passing through a cloud o sawdust enters the Knight.  Without pause he topples a ki shelf onto a supine Romirez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romirez.  What a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romirez is struggling under the debris. The Knight thrusts hard onto an exposed leg. The limb is severed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madonna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight begins casting aside the shelving. With lightning speed Romirez pulls the sword from beneath bed and hammers it deep into the Knight's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crashes back against the wall. Romirez tries to lift himself from the bed using his swor as a crutch. The Knight has regained a meager balance on his knees. Blood pours from the slice in his stomach, Romirez pushes himself across the bed, plants his sword i the floor and hobbles a few paces before collapsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Santa Maria!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight crawls across the bed and drops to his knees beside Romirez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demonio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight's trembling hands raise his shaking sword high

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor pounds at a horseshoe. The hammer slips from his grasp as he slumps forward as i pushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badly wounded, the Knight staggers through the shattered doorway and tumbles into the street. A CHILD SCREAMS. Pulling himself up, the Knight hobbles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor is running through the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor rushes in and shudders to a stop. An entire wall is showered with blood. Conor walks slowly forward.  Dazed. As he looks down something takes his attention. It is Romirez's severed head. Conor moans in anguish and drops to his knees on the bloo stained floor. His head sinks to his chest as he begins sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in the bowels of the museum, the RESEARCH LIBRARIAN, a wiry young man, sits at his cluttered desk. Brenna looms above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Brenna, your ass is already in a sling, don't drag me into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need is for you to check the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to your supervisor lately?  He's burning up the place about you just dropping out of sight.  That on top of the cops bugging him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of that Corey, but I need this now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The librarian looks her over skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey, you _owe_ me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The librarian reluctantly reaches for his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding Brenna's photograph, the research librarian is co ing through stained binders.  The room is old, disorganiz and gives the impression that every fact worth knowing mu be in it somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing it on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good way to lose your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some job.  Card filing and cabinet dusting.  Four years in this dump and I haven't written anything for Wilson that a wounded yak couldn't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked the bit you did about Baltic chastity belts. Too bad no one else did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bullshit.  Everything. My job, the people I get involved with, I'm up to here with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always were hard to impress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The librarian pulls a binder and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not who.  What.  Worstick's a town in Pennsylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna enters and sits at her desk.  She is looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Chris, have you seen my notebook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is seated at the desk next to her.  He points at th supervisor's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, that son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high backed office chair is spun away from an angry, entering Brenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong Wilson, huh?  Not enough excitement in your own desk?  What the hell were you looking for in mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair turns.  Detective Moran, not her supervisor, le through her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better have a warrant.  That's my notebook, you've got no right to be sticking your fingers into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a morgue filling up with bodies.  That's my right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the man of the hour that we all would like to talk to about now has apparently skipped town. (looks at notebook) And all of a sudden the Smithsonian's ambulence chaser is an expert on missing persons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna lifts the telephone receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling an attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I should talk first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran presses the post on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to tell them?  That you're protecting a man who's killed four people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All fashionably without heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's more.  Wednesday someone played javelin with the cemetary curator in Felton, Delaware.  Some locals spotted two cars with D.C. plates and surprise surprise, they turn out to be registered to our own Brenna Cartwright and the ever popular Richard Taupin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you getting at, Moran?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been a busy little beaver. Especially with that records mess up in Church Hill. (looks at notebook) Your notes are very complete. Naturally my feelings were crushed when you didn't rush right over and tell us what you knew. (looks up) In fact, we're considering book- ing the ambulence chaser as an accessory to murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll never stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we might just give it the 'ole college try.  What with the court back ups, it could be days before you got an arraignment. But then, I'm sure the flunk-out neice of the D.A. knows all about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole, Moran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Taupin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure he's the one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for laughs we raided wonder boy's house.  There was a gallon of one of the corpse's blood in his carpet.  I think it was about then I withdrew his name for humanitarian of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all of this got to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in Felton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research.  If your pal was there I never saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have witnesses that can put the two of you together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows he's bluffing) Never take up poker, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid, lady.  Your neck can be sliced as fast as anyone else's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna reaches across and lifts her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you wait until it comes out in paperback?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran watches her leave.  He lifts the telephone receiver

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH OFFICE
dialogues.text: Striding out into the corridor, Brenna passes Dennis, the from her bedroom, leaning against the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRIEST celebrates mass in a present-day cathedral. In the rear of the church apart from the other PARISHIONE sits the Knight.  As the priest leads the parishioners th the procession of faith, the Knight alone repeats it quie to himself in Latin, the ancient language of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crooked tombstones strewn across the bleached ground of a not beloning to reality. In full medieval tartan, Conor stands against a forceful

dialogues.speaker: CRACKS
dialogues.text: Run the length plain, spewing forth steam and staggering SKELETONS.  There are dozens of them, all carrying their under one arm. The skeletons press forward and trap Conor against the tr of a dead oak.  The heads break into harsh, demonic LAUGH Conor puts his hands over his ears in pain as the bodies forward. SCREAMING, he disappears under a mass of gleaming bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin wakes from the dream with a SHOUT. He has fallen asleep in a desk chair. Taupin walks to a window and looks out to the green hills the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna's sedan shoots down a country highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking her rear view mirror, Brenna notices two suspici FIGURES in a car behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna pulls to the side.  The car from behind passes wit incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna is driving again.  Listening now to the RADIO, she casts a glance in the mirror.  The same car is behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing over a rise in the highway, Brenna turns abruptly onto a service road and behind a group of trees.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER CAR
dialogues.text: Pauses a moment at the intersection, then drives on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna shows the PROPRIETOR the photograph.  He explains something to her. Brenna steps outside the store onto the Main Street of th very small community of Worstick.

dialogues.speaker: AT A STREET CORNER
dialogues.text: Brenna passes a small monument settled in a flower bed. a plaque memorializing five locals murdered in 1931.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mile out of town Brenna stops at a farmhouse.  She chec it against the photo she found at Taupin's townhouse.  Th match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna KNOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna whirls around and sees Taupin behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're you followed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one knows you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I had to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to do _nothing_!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Taupin strides through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna and Taupin enter.  A heavy broad sword sits on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what you killed them with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been listening to rumors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our cars were seen together in Felton.  They're calling me an accessory to murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  They're stuck with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's several bedrooms down the hall.  Take your pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a strange decor.  18th century paintings hang beside grotesque medieval carvings. Brenna's face softens with worry.  What is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plain-clothed POLICE OFFICER is in mid conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's the last place we saw her.  Okay, will do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) We keep looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin sits at his desk.  Before him is spread out blank certificates, driver licenses and title deeds.  His eyes to the corridor where Brenna is.  An idea has come to him Brenna enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Taupin has become cumbersome.  It would be best if he just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna walks to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did kill those men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you finish, what then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go my way and you can write all you want about the big bad Mr. Taupin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make it all sound so simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only real difficulty comes in changing over the ownership of property I've aquired.  That requires certain records and most importantly a personal appearance at the county seat in Gettysburg.  But that's where you come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to front for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The less exposure I recieve around government buildings the better.  You, as Mrs. Taupin, will attract considerably less attention than I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna is unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not such a bad trade.  The story of a lifetime for a few days work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Moran looks through the broken remains of the l room. An INSPECTOR enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lost her outside of Thurmont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran sighs and tosses a piece of wood on the pile of deb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want people in here to check over every piece of this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure she's with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ran down that Church Hill info. She's right.  There is no Richard Taupin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other I.D.s come up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.  Called FBI yesterday. Thompson's going to try CIA this afternoon. (shrugs) Y'never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran rises and dons his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should have seen him the first night.  Son of a bitch stood there with a quart of blood on his pant leg and didn't even blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think he'd had practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor, now MAJOR DUPONT of the French infantry, pours ove battle plans. An AIDE, dressed as Conor-Dupont in 18th century European military garb, enters the command area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are assembled, Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GENERAL stands beside the major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that they are indeed ready, Dupont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A regiment of INFANTRYMEN, pale blue coat tails tossing i the light breeze, stand at attention. A STAFF SARGEANT presents the men to Dupont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regiment ready for review, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont walks past the sargeant to the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to soldier) Stand straight, you are a soldier of the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont continues down the line.  Another soldier's infant jacket is almost hilariously mis-buttoned, one collar sti up four inches higher than the other. Dupont with both hands rips open the soldier's coat, spra brass buttons onto the ground. He moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to soldier) Where is your bayonet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost it sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier hedges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the Major!  Where!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whorehouse sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont's face softens in exasperation, then toughens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your rifle.  Hand it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier obeys.  Dupont inspects the firing mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flint is cracked.  No spark will reach your powder.  You will die tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the rifle roughly back into the soldier's hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow you go to _battle_!  And you look like children! (beat) The General has charged me with seeing that you are prepared, and prepared you will be!  If necessary you stand here all night!  Sargeant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sargeant leaps to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont turns briskly, then stops abruptly as if alerted b thing.  He whirls around and faces the young infantrymen. His expression is quizzical as he walks the line, checkin each face carefully. One PRIVATE seizes his attention.  The private is cautiou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is as if Dupont knows him.  The two stare at each othe Dupont turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside a small farmhouse commandeered for officer's quart Dupont (Conor) and several others eat their evening meal. A CAPTAIN finishes his story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) ...And what a sight!  That old mare just kept falling over her own guts till someone finally shot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OFFICERS LAUGH.  All but Dupont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beside Dupont) Complete your inspection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're nothing but boys.  It will be a slaughter tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I doubt much can change that. The enemy has five brigades waiting for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't get it. (shrugs) We are a sacrifice.  A diversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont pokes unenthusiastically at his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat up Dupont.  It will probably be your last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises) Not likely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont goes to the window.  Dusk shines orange on his fac In the foreground the man Dupont encountered at the line- Mulet, is chopping firewood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hours later. Most are asleep.  Mulet continues his wood splitting. From out of the dark cottage steps Dupont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I gave orders the regiment was to drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staff sargeant detailed me to prepare firewood for the break- fast cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second musketeer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you joined up in Bremen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to understand a great deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a Major, Private.  You would do well remembering that when addressing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, "sir".  I thought we spoke as equals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Equals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) If you wish to play games, Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulet returns to his chore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  I think we understand each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it is time two of us did. You are very young.  I was once young.  I can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulet LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help?  I've seen others "help". Somehow a head always ended up on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be different.  It must be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never changes, Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulet turns to his chore.  Dupont grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes him off) Stay out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Don't threaten me, Private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgust) Who do you think I am?  One of your freckle faced children waiting to die tomorrow?  "Threaten you"?  You and I just living will always be a threat.  Forever.  Look at your life, Major.  Look at mine.  Nothing there but threat.  Threats and nothingness. It's what we live for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulet turns his back on Dupont. Dupont draws his cutlass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not turn your back on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are really going to force this, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either you are with me or against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulet turns slowly, axe in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I a choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two stare into eyes empty of emotion. Mulet's hand flinches.  An attack? Dupont CUTS quickly, slicing open both of Mulet's arms. The axe drops to the ground. Mulet seems strangely calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see Major?  You are not so different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont cuts off Mulet's head where he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont drags the corpse across the meadow and dumps it in a swamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very late.  Only a few OFFICERS are seated in the p Dupont tries to concentrate on prayer, but is distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice flashback) You see Major?  You are not so different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont sighs and looks to the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I deceiving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont whirls around to see the Knight, dressed as he in sitting one row behind. Dupont leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't look so flushed, Major.  You are quite safe in church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont eases his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State of grace and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont has backed up a few paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this time and still a scared little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps not. (smiles) You seem to have misplaced a private.  No doubt by now his head is stranger to his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You surprise me.  Eliminating a rival like that.  Such are the actions of a man of conquest.  I was mistaken.  300 years have turned the boy's fear into ambit- ion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you very well, Conor MacLeod. And I can see the truth beginning to make itself clear to you.  Mulet, Romirez, they were fools without vision.  It was destined that the board would be cleared for the real players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight almost seems proud of Dupont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romirez understood.  Not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romirez is dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight looks to the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish your prayers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Our common heritage. (beat) I am your only real friend, you know.  The only one who truly understands you. (rises) I look forward to the day we meet again.  And I kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight leans forward and puts his face very near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stay in church forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight moves into the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits. Conor sits in the dim church alone.  Very alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Taupin sits against the stone of an old Catholic Taupin sighs.  A long, weary sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin and Brenna sit at a table working on forms. Taupin looks up from his work and studies Brenna's face w malice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna and Taupin are taking a walk along the township's outskirts. Crossing a small bridge over a smaller creek, they encoun the elderly caretaker Mr. North and his eight year old GR Both with fishing poles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Mr. North

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a pretty day.  If I live to be 90 I'll never tire of mornings like this.  Mind you I'm 74 now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.  When you get older your priorities change.  It's the simple things that count.  Without them growing old can be a very lonely thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grandson is having difficulty baiting his line.  Taup down beside the young fisherman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes worm) Here.  The hook should go just below the head, where the meat is toughest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin's show of affection surprises Brenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show you a trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin takes a clump of leaves from the bridge and winds around the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish are creatures of habit.  They like their food where they're used to it.  At the top, hiding in old leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you learn that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father taught me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father must be smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna is touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna lies on her bed thinking.  She puts on a robe and into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taupin sits before the fireplace, its flames reflecting o brandy glass.  Brenna moves quietly to a seat beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on the fireplace) There was a man once.  Just a simple woodcarver.  But he understood.  More than anyone he could see to the heart of it. (beat) It never ends.  Today is the same as the first.  Tomorrow will be the same as today.  So much time.  And all of it wasted. (beat) You love history?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna looks through a property zoning book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking past small town stores, Brenna allows herself a m to window shop.

dialogues.speaker: IN A SHOP WINDOW
dialogues.text: Is a small poster advertising a community get-together. peels it off the glass and slips it into her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna and Taupin go over various forms and documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The estate stuff is pretty straight forward.  Just lots of forms and an appearance at the county seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will take some time for the forms to clear before you go to Gettysburg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) So what now?  We just wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as long as we're stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the poster from earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some sort of party the town is throwing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do it each year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it might be a nice break from all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin stacks the documents into a folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it would do us both good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a catch.  You're supposed to wear 19th century clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin is going through an old trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was something of a junk collector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes across a long period dress and offers it to Bren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, try this.  I suppose they're still making women the same as back then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little dusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin fishes through the trunk and comes up with an old hat.  He turns it over in his hand with stoic memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor and a beautiful young woman, KATHERINE, sit on the steps in 1800s period dress.  Other young COUPLES relax n enjoying the warm summer's twilight.  Katherine's MOTHER between the couples offering lemonade, cakes, and the lik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is thoroughly charmed by Conor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor wraps a length of yarn about his fingers.  By turni hand over and bending his knuckles just so, the web becom outline of a lion..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lion. (growls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine is delighted. Conor starts to remove the yarn.  Katherine touches his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please.  Another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor cups his hands, bends his fingers, and comes up wit four leaf clover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful.  Where did you ever learn it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor shoots a glance for the mother, then kisses Katheri softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) You'll be leaving the girl alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MAN stands a few yards from the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have cause to bothering us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, we've already spoken of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not what he pretends to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor climbs to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best leave, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're so high and mighty, coming into town and taking a man's woman.  Well I know about you.  I know about the things you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving closer) I said you best leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd like that, wouldn't you? (to Katherine) Ask him about his friends.  The ones he meets in the town square. Ask him about the blade he keeps beneath his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor grabs the youth's collar and pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like ice) Leave.  While you still can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The youth pushes away from the grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't frighten me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man throws a fist at Conor.  It is easily block Conor returns with a savage blow to the chest that knocks the young man gasping onto the ground. Katherine runs up behind and grabs Conor's outstretched a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Leave him.  Please don't hurt him. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUGHING painfully, the youth climbs to his feet and stag away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and runs down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not what you think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine turns to Conor, his face still locked in ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who you are or where you come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor's face softens as he brings up an arm to hold her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An auditorium has been transformed with colored lights an strung paper into a small town party. TEENAGERS in period dress control the floor, dancing to a decidedly un-period ROCK BAND. The OLDER GUESTS are gathered around the punch bowl talki crops or Pennsylvania politics.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNA
dialogues.text: Fitted as well as can be expected in her lace dress, ente with Taupin, himself dressed in a formal suit complete wi His clothes fit perfectly. Mr. North, comically dressed as a pirate, greets them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taupin!  Glad you could make it. Best get some punch before it's gone.  Near the whole valley showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go to the table. Taupin pours a glass of punch.  An ELDERLY WOMAN approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't know better I'd say William Taupin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His son.  Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taupin is up from Washington to look over his father's estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father died some years ago. This is your first visit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tone is snide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of sorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose a Taupin had to show up eventually. (walks away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mrs. Butler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns in surprise at his knowing her name, then walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was all that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Mr. Taupin.  That's not meant for you.  Just some didn't take much to your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was never one for social whirls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kept to himself for sure.  Then with all that business in '31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family down the road from the Taupin place was murdered.  All cut up they were.  Horrible.  Two strangers were also found with the bodies.  No one ever accused William, but with his reputation as a loner and the rumors about him and some of the wives in town, folks just never forgot.  Most were relieved when they heard he'd died.  Sorry Mr. Taupin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to be sorry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just your pappy scared some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock band finished as a PORTLY MAN in a union soldier uniform takes the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, the kids have had their fun.  Now it's time for a little more traditional dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock band gives ground to a group of older MUSICIANS. a nod from the union soldier they begin a folk tune with and hammer dulcimer. The costumed guests take to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know any of these.  I'll make a fool of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin starts into it with perfect grace.  A faltering Br tries to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William Taupin seems to have left his mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are William Taupin, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do a final turn and finish.  The other DANCERS appla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're using your son's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Just the child of some lonely girl I gave a ride to.  When they died I put them in a grave with my name on it. Twenty years later I became the son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna is staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More punch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her to a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must be at least 70 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the ELDERLY WOMEN are watching Taupin from acr the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus with "Gettysburg" across the front pulls to a stop a dark terminal.  A lone passenger steps off into the mis It is the Knight, bound up in a leather jacket and carryi only a long, narrow case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna and Taupin walk alone in the night outside the hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's frightening sometimes the way you talk about other people's lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A factor of age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I never get that old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be insane.  Leaving work, ditching cops.  All to follow a murderer.  A very old murderer, but a murderer just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been telling myself it's the award winning journal article I'm going to write.  But it's not. (looks at him squarely) It's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even sure why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly a reason to run off with a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life has been chock full of people with complications and weak- nesses.  I can't stand it.  But you're different.  It's in your hands.  A clarity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a very perceptive young woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thoughtful pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Cartwright, it's time I showed you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin and Brenna descend the stairs to a seemingly flush Taupin reaches behind a bookcase and pulls something.  A from his hand and the wall becomes a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures to interior) Miss Cartwright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna steps uneasily into the darkness.  Taupin follows switches on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna's expression changes to awe. The room is massive, a cross between a museum and an old Suits of armor, Italian statuettes, Czech ironworks, Pers fetishes and a thousand other oddities from a hundred era crowd the shelving and floor space. The room has the look of ownership, as if civilization ha taken the time to keep a scrapbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sight is overwhelming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had this room built some time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna picks up a Carolingian tapestry and runs her hand its intricate weaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be difficult to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin picks up a Byzantine icon, brushing the dust from shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born Conor MacLeod in the village of Ardvrek on the High- land plain of Strathnaver in the clan of MacLeod under the King of Scotland.  On the eleventh of December, 1408.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He replaces the icon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have served in the armies of twelve nations, married nine women, fathered thirty-eight children and buried them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin walks along the cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I carried that rifle in World War I.  This book is a 16th Century policy report for the King of Austria.  The diploma is my con- ference of degree in Latin from Trinity College.  Class of 1672. (beat) It goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why Smith called you MacLeod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is older than I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could possibly be worth all this murder and distruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think it's just for something to do.  A conquest to be the last.  Something to hold onto while everything else around you withers and blows away.  Some- thing to replace the love that can never work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps.  There is something more. An inheritance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill the watchman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed those other two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that family in '31?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes innocents become involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and your buddy make a real team, don't you?  Exchanging eloquent threats in iambic pen- tameter while hacking up all the innocents in between.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are differences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kill with your left hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't killed _you_.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a threat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin moves very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna's face softens.  She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Brenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RELATIVES in period dress watch as a family member is low into the ground. A very OLD WOMAN stands stoically, supported on both side her middle aged SONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May God commend into his kingdom the soul of our dear departed Jason, son of Katherine-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And brother to Howard and James-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two middle aged sons.

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Watches the funeral quietly at a distance.

dialogues.speaker: THE OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: As the minister continues allows her gaze to wander.  She Conor standing at the treeline.  Her eyes crinkle in disb Releasing herself from her sons, she hobbles toward Conor Confused, the brothers watch their mother leave the cerem

dialogues.speaker: CONOR
dialogues.text: Watches the woman approach but decides against moving. She stops a few paces away and looks over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe him this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never knew you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two sons come up behind.  The three stand there: an o woman who could be 60 years Conor's senior and her two so old enough to be his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard.  James.  This is your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin and Brenna lie together. Running her hands along the contours of his body she sees countless faint scars of bullet and sword wounds. Taupin strokes her softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Brenna".  In Celtic is means "woman with raven hair".  Only chieftan's daughters were allowed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna is lost in Taupin's scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it like?  Being you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.  And fear.  Fear of those that would kill you and fear of those that would love you.  It can never last, and in the end you always end up destroying both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're known so much. History I'll only read about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all the same.  Half lives that never go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of it finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin and Brenna stand beside her car.  She has an armlo of documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gettysburg's an hour's drive at most.  You should be back by nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.  Don't stay any longer than you have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Brenna considers touching him but instead climbs into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Moran and his Inspector walk among parked squad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't know till the records department comes back with it this after- noon.  Looks good though. They found the receipt in his townhouse.  It was pretty smeared but had Taupin's father listed as a signatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round up who you can and put them on standby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think we should call the local P.D. out there first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I want this to be all ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna is standing at a counter signing the last of a sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K. Mrs. Taupin, that's all I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk fills out a small sheet and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take this down the hall to the regis- trar.  Hurry up though, it's near closing time. Most everyone's gone home already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of Levis follow Brenna at a distance down the corr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sealed from the corridor by a pair of doors, two CLERKS sit in an office mostly cleared of employees. Brenna hands the slip to a clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappears into the rear area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other clerk) Do you have a drinking fountain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna steps around and takes a drink.  She looks into he reflection on the stainless steel and spends a moment fid with her hair.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLERK
dialogues.text: Still hasn't returned.  Brenna drums her fingers on the counter top and looks around the office. The second clerk is also gone. Brenna sees something unfamiliar on the second clerk's de She steps over to it. It is a large blood stain. Brenna shoots a glance to the double doors. They're closed. Brenna rushes to the doors.  Someone's locked them. She struggles with the handles, then turns to see the Kni walking to her with his stained sword. With a SCREAM she kicks a rolling office chair into him a runs down an opposite corridor.

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Flings the chair aside and knocks open the door with a SL of his palm.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNA
dialogues.text: Has run out of corridor.  She looks back at the Knight cl the distance.  CRYING in fear, she frantically searches f a way out. The Knight is nearly upon her. In desperation she runs into a janitorial closet, closing its heavy door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is dark and full of old paint cans and mops.  Her BREATHI is at a PANIC.

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Tries the door handle. Stepping back, he lifts his sword and HAMMERS it deep int the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He STRIKES again.  And again.  Splinters smack against su ing walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away!  Oh God, go away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRYING hysterically, Brenna presses herself against the f wall, sliding to the floor in a crouch.

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Steps back and gives the door a last two-fisted swing. Brenna SCREAMS. The door collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of unmarked police cars race by with the last lig of day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the wheel is Moran's assistant, the inspector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin stands at his fireplace, the only light in the roo poking at it with a tong. His gaze goes to a mantle clock. It is 10:30 PM. The phone RINGS. He looks to it. It RINGS again. He picks up the receiver slowly and places it against his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have some unfinished business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to come to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I refuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me an address where I can forward Miss Cart- wright's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This affects him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes laddie, I have her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmarked cars shoot by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin hangs up the phone. He looks to the sword on the table, reflecting the fireli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE OFFICERS, placed around Taupin's house, are COCKIN shotguns and CHAMBERING pistols. Two officers take positions on either side of the door. third, after getting the signal, kicks the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers drop to firing positions in the doorway.  Th room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An officer BURSTS in.  It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inspector is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotlights seperate the whitemarble from the surrounding blackness. Taupin's face moves into frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sword firmly in one hand, Taupin climb's the monument's s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twenty-five foot bronze of Thomas Jefferson flanked by quotations. A sword in one hand and Brenna in the other, the Knight s at the statue's base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin stands at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kahn sends his best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a corner the Asian's head lies on its side, the horror death still pressed into the face.  Taupin's eyes return to the Knight and Brenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight throws Brenna roughly against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappoint me. (looks at Brenna) I thought you'd finally gotten over that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight holds his sword out at a ceremonial angle.  Ta does the same.  The weapons are CLANKED together twice, t pulled back into battle position. The two begin walking a circle, poised swords waiting for opening. The Knight leaps first, his clash of steel RINGING off th walls. Another ATTACK without result.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin swings.  The Knight jumps back.  Sweat gleams from brows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two LOVERS enjoy a late night walk along the tidal basin. There is a distant CLANKING of metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from over near the memorial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps up on a rock.  Several yards away can be seen tw attacking each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing at a map of the city, Moran nurses a cup of coff The phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran.  All right, get a patrol unit out there right away.  I'll meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight and Taupin are PANTING heavily. The Knight goes low.  Taupin blocks.  The Knight comes ov quickly.  Taupin misjudges and the blade slices deep into shoulder and chest.  The impact knocks him flat on his ba The Knight looks down on his wounded prey. A SCREECH of brakes from outside the monument.  Two OFFIC are coming up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers reach the top and enter.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: One of the officers is Dennis, who sees only a CRYING Bre and Taupin lying wounded on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight rushes up from behind, his sword in full swing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran's car blows through a cross street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran is at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight walks from the two officers spread out like ra dolls on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Taupin) Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin looks at Brenna and the dead policemen.  A resigna sweeps over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't done.  Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point!  You have me, finish it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have waited forever for this. You will not cheapen it, little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irony) Tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight looks to Brenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps Miss Cartwright would like to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin struggles to his feet.  Blood pouring from his shi stands uneasily with his sword at ready. The Knight swings.  Taupin blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran drives up.  There is an empty police car, the door ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin is badly outclassed. He feebly fends off an attack, but the Knight returns qui with a savage SLICE that rips open Taupin's stomach and t him again to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be silent!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice is THUNDERING. Taupin kneels with his forehead pressed against the floor teeth grind in pain. The Knight smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do hope you're enjoying this as much as me.

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Stands in the entryway.  The Knight sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran draws his pistol. The Knight walks toward him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nothing that concerns you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moran levels his gun. The Knight raises his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will leave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two EXPLOSIONS as Moran FIRES.  The slugs slam into the K blowing him off his feet. He lies still. Moran looks to Brenna.  To Taupin.  Then he walks closer Knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin curls in a spasm of pain. Moran moves closer. The Knight lies face down, blood oozing from exit wounds his heart.  He isn't breathing. Moran bends over slowly to see the Knight's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.  You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight suddenly rolls over and plants his sword into chest.  The pistol DISCHARGES against a far wall. Taupin crawls for the Knight. Moran's mouth opens but no sound escapes.  The Knight, bl pouring from his mouth and nose, thrusts deeper then retr quickly. Moran slides off the sword dead. Taupin CUTS hard against the Knight's chest.  The Knight in surprise and crumples.  Taupin CUTS again, then puts t blade against the Knight's GURGLING throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In mamus tuas Domine commendo spiritum meum.  Auditorium nostrum in nomine Domine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Requiescant in pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And CUTS the Knight's head off. Taupin drops his sword. His breathing quickens. A sensation sweeps over him. Taupin drops to the floor WHIMPERING.  He sucks in painfu of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin bolts up and looks at her without seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin is looking past her. A blood-stained hand suddenly GRABS Brenna's shoulder.  S SCREAMS.  The headless body of the Knight stands beside h

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIGHT'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Lies on the floor. The eyes open.  The face pulls into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eyes roll up into the skull.  The face slackens. The hulking mass standing beside Brenna sways, the collap to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TAUPIN
dialogues.text: Is CRYING.  Not from wounds he no longer feels, but from else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stand it.  Oh God, I can't stand it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna kneels beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scream of your blood.  The shriek of trees.  Stop it!  Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna SOBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the last.  Oh Christ, I'm the _last one_!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin doubles over in pain.  The pain of the whole world to force itself into him. Brenna tries to hold him.  He pushes her savagely away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll destroy you.  I've destroyed everything I've ever touched!  Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doubles over in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his sword and threatens her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _Get out_!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOBBING, Brenna runs from the memorial.  Taupin is alone. Bleeding.  Crying.  In agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna at work in the research area.  She's silent.  Dist Something is missing from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna stands in the street before Taupin's townhouse. A boarded up window.  A for-sale sign.  Taupin is gone fo As if he never was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A desk.  A single light.  A cup of coffee. A typewriter. Brenna tries to force thoughts to the surface.  CLACK-CLA It is at last her journal article.  She types a line, the it from the carriage and tears it to pieces. The thoughts won't come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna sits on the expanse of grass throwing scraps to a of wild park cats. A shadow covers her face.  She looks up. It is Taupin. Something has changed him.  His face is less cynical.  Mo vulnerable.  More human. He sits down on the grass beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) What are we supposed to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat's eyes are all fixed in Taupin.  They cautiously away, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emptyness.  The years and years of void.  Nothingness.  Bordered only by the quest for ultimate nothingness. Who would have guessed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inheritance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not power.  Not control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taupin holds a blade of grass as if it was speaking to hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life.  It is the gift and the under- standing of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have lived forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is only life when it is bounded by death.  The inheritance is death. The gift is the finality of life. To be part of the fabric.  The inside. (turns to Brenna) I love you Brenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenna's chin quivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be horrible.  The future.  I may die tomorrow or 10,000 tomorrows. I can promise you nothing.  Nothing but a moment.  Maybe two.  But a moment of love, is that not worth a lifetime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her.  They hold each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken me so long.  So very long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jogger runs by, unaware of any life but his own.
